website_summaries.verdict: Amazon's stick-sized version of the Fire TV media hub is less than half the price and offers all of the same appealing features, save for sheer speed.
pros: Lots of content and services available, especially for Amazon Prime members
cons: Not as quick as the Fire TV
Interface is curated primarily around Amazon content

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS OR ANY OTHER FIRE STICK THEY BURN FINGER AND TELEVISIONS
customer_reviews.text: I have been trying for two hours to contact Amazon regarding this product, there is no way to contact them. It has got so hot that it has burnt my fingers and ruined my television. Every avenue I have tried to contact this devious company has failed. I took their reputation with a grain of salt but now I believe it. DON'T TRUST THEM AND DON'T WHATEVER YOU DO BUY A FIRESTICK FROM THEM. I AM NOW GOING ON EVERY WEB SITE I CAN TO WARN THEM OF THEIR SHARP PRACTICES. I'VE JUST LEARNT THEY ARE AWARE OF THIS PROBLEM BUT TAKE NO RESPONSIBILITY. WHAT A SURPRISE. WONDER HOW LONG BEFORE THEY SCRUB THIS OUT.
customer_reviews.author: Ravenhunter

customer_reviews.title: The technology is great for enhancing a smart TV, but....
customer_reviews.text: Compared to LG apps and TalkTalk, Amazon appears better. However, it's difficult to find really high quality movies and documentaries, which is the only thing that I'm interested in. It tends to be full of UFO and zombie movies. It has a web browser, but currently no favourites capability. The user interface is constantly being refined, so maybe one day it will be perfect. I get the feeling that the only answer to the problem is for all competing systems to amalgamate, and for it to produce really high quality programmes.
customer_reviews.author: MR A.

customer_reviews.title: Fire TV Stick - Update re YouTube App - FREEZES
customer_reviews.text: I use Fire TV Stick primarily for YouTube. Since the recent FS update where the YouTube app was removed and YouTube can only now be accessed via a Browser, YouTube is virtually unwatchable. The browser cannot cope and FS-TV either buffers far too frequently or it freezes. The Fire TV then needs a power-off reset. AMAZON! SORT THIS! RE-INSTATE YOUTUBE AS AN APP NOW!!!! Then, and only then, will I revise this ONE STAR rating
customer_reviews.author: Xjayar

customer_reviews.title: but it has really disappointed me. Regularly takes a long time to load ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to as a media player instead of my PS4. I expected a difference in quality, but it has really disappointed me. Regularly takes a long time to load TV shows and switches between low quality and HD regularly throughout the program. Iplayer regularly becomes disjointed with the sound and visuals coming out of sync. I normally end up getting half way through something and then using my PS4 which works. There are a number of additional issues which really hinder its functionality. I wish I could return it and get my money back.
customer_reviews.author: charles gray

customer_reviews.title: Great way to make your TV a smart TV - good for Amazon Prime & Netflix
customer_reviews.text: Simple and easy to use, very easy to set up. You simply plug into the back of your TV set - I use it on the upstairs bedroom set. I mainly use to watch Amazon Prime and Netflix. Although this is an Amazon product, it has access to a Netflix app so that's a big bonus. Connection via my wi-fi works brilliantly...hardly ever seen it buffer and picture quality great (obviously it might vary depending on your wifi). Remote quite small and very straightforward to navigate - newer versions to this model have voice search facility as well. A neat and useful addition to aid your TV viewing - no complaints, very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Yellowbelly Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: It's like a portable operating system.
customer_reviews.text: I got one of these on a lightning deal on Prime Day for less than £20. I needed a portable alternative to streaming movies on my tv (I get fed up of using PS4) so we decided to invest in a few of these round the house. Each room in our house has a tv and a firestick installed, it's so convenient as we can all watch Amazon Movies simultaneously without having to all use the PS4 or Xbox. Installation is easy and it comes with an extension wire for charging etc. Overall a good alternative to streaming using a PS4 or Xbox.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan O'neill

customer_reviews.title: It's OK
customer_reviews.text: The unit is robust and loos teh part, comes with flexible HDMI extension. the remote is sleek and feels nice to the touch responsive. The unit performance It's Ok, but there are issues with both picture quality pixelation and drop outs even with a strong wi-fi signal. Its a shame really as it's built well. Searching the web it is suggested to use different power cables from other loeading brands which I hsve not explored to date. Ideal if you are travelling in the UK and like to experience more than the standard freeview.
customer_reviews.author: Harry_wmp

customer_reviews.title: Could be better.
customer_reviews.text: Its ok. The controller is temperamental and needs stroking and talking dirty too on occasions to make it work. The plug in device would be fine with most TVs but my newly purchased Sharpe TV has a stupid small section to contain any leads to be plugged in. The the Fire Sticks fault but i have had to purchase a short HDMI male and female lead so i can extend the connection point. Could be a smaller bit of kit or with a flexible lead like the Chrome stick thingy. Having said that I doubt Amazon will allow this report to be published as they vet things like the Nazi party used to.
customer_reviews.author: Craig J. M. Thomson

customer_reviews.title: Great value for money and so easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 of these on Black Friday and got them at a discounted price. I have always put myself of getting one as I'm not very good with technical stuff but these fire sticks are so easy to use and been an Amazon prime member it's great for signing into my account and having the choice of films or tv series to watch. Now me and my partner don't need to fight for the remote he sits in the room watching his footy or fishing programs while I watch all my tv shows in the living room haha! Should have purchased 2 of these ages ago. Even at the £35 they are great value for money
customer_reviews.author: Happyshopper

customer_reviews.title: Died after just over a year of use
customer_reviews.text: Being 'previous generation', I suppose reviewing this product is pointless! Anyway, after just over a year of use, mine has now died (fried motherboard I'm guessing) from no apparent mistreatment. Whilst working it did the job well enough, especially as I have Amazon Prime. It would occasionally be very slow to go through menus and once or twice just wiped everything and rebooted. So, I haven't been overly impressed with it on balance and don't intend on buying a replacement!
customer_reviews.author: Bryn Pickering

customer_reviews.title: When things go wrong
customer_reviews.text: My Fire tv stick has been fine until last night. A message popped up on my screen to say that my Fire stick was overheating and that I needed to contact Amazon. This, however, has proved to be impossible. As none of the help topics cover how to get to the "live chat" or "e-mail" address - I have been unable to make the contact requested in the message. AMAZON - PUT YOUR HOUSE IN ORDER AND WHEN YOU HAVE A "CONTACT US" SECTION WE NEED IT TO BE INFORMATION ON HOW TO DO THAT - NOT DROPDOWNS THAT DON'T FIT THE BILL. EITHER A "LIVE CHAT" BUTTON - OR AN E-MAIL LINK IS NEEDED TO DO THIS.
customer_reviews.author: T4bsF

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE! This could cause Picture Interference on Freeview TV
customer_reviews.text: I really like this item.. Great display, attractive layout, easy navigation, great choice of films, apps and TV etc (although many Prime Films are old or currently showing anyway) HOWEVER, For many months, picture interference plagued my TV when trying to watch Freeview (through TV source, not through Cable source) Engineers scratched their heads and costs were discussed. A 4g filter was tried, still no help. Eventually, after a chance event, I took out the Kindle Firestick plug and Hey Presto, problem solved!! This almost cost me a brand new TV so please beware.
customer_reviews.author: nikki44

customer_reviews.title: We have a beloved old TV that we love but wanted to access Netflix and Amazon Prime from
customer_reviews.text: We have a beloved old TV that we love but wanted to access Netflix and Amazon Prime from. This was perfect. Easy to use and install and access to so much content. I advise you spend 20 minutes setting ups - BBC, ITV and Channel 4 have been good additions. The interface is simple to use and the password system for younger viewer restrictions is easy to set up. The search function includes Netflix so you get to see what's available for free as wells to rent/buy. You can take it away with you as well - perfect holiday accompaniment!
customer_reviews.author: Mr S Glover

customer_reviews.title: YouTube being pulled form this device in Jan 2018
customer_reviews.text: As some of you know by now Amazon will be removing YouTube from this product in January 2018, the reason is a petty squabble with one another! Of course the people who lose out here are the customers who put their faith in this product and bought it in the first place. Frankly speaking.., without YouTube the FireTV will be a bitter disappointment to new users and one which leaves a very bad taste in the mouth of existing customers who regularly use this app. If you like YouTube as many of us do, don't buy a FireTV Stick!
customer_reviews.author: Max Headroom

customer_reviews.title: Great Item but maybe better going with a TV box.
customer_reviews.text: Good piece of kit but maybe a bit behind the times now. Given Amazon now have the Fire TV Box I would suggest that these sticks may well become a thing of the past. Great item if you simply want to turn your TV into a smart TV. Positives for this item would have to be that it is well hidden, you simply plug it into the HDMI port on your TV and the USB cable into a power source (can also be plugged directly into your TV if yours has a USB slot). The only issue I have had with these is that they sometimes have a tendency to overheat.
customer_reviews.author: AndyB Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Was useful but has glitches
customer_reviews.text: We've had this for awhile. Once we load singing, like Netflix, the screen will go black after a few minutes of watching something and then come back. I did ring tech support. Although they were helpful they didn't solve the issue. I tried using it for the first time in awhile the other day and our home screen wouldn't load either. When we used it more frequently, the sick was useful because we had Amazon prime, catch up and Netflix all in one place. Bar the glitch, which we got over, it had been a very handy product. We've not had it a year though and we're now encountering another problem with it not loading.
customer_reviews.author: becky

customer_reviews.title: Prepare to become chair shaped.
customer_reviews.text: We had no preconceived ideas about this stick. We had previously had a NOW Tv box for 6 months. So knew roughly what to expect but this stick is so much better. Being able to watch near enough full box sets, is terribly addictive. Be careful. Some large box sets, like walking dead for example do not have the last two seasons for free. You pay extra. Lucifer is my personal favourite. Good range of films. All excellent quality. We bought another stick as you can run two off one prime account.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this along with Amazon prime as a Christmas present for my husband. He was struggling using the sky remote and would become frustrated because he couldn't remember which button to use. This is so easy to use, though he does occasionally press the wrong button and he get's annoted when he can't find the program he wants (not a problom for me). Used alongside Prime - we are loving it. There's some fantastic programs on prime especially enjoying Viking's and the quality is amazing! Sky has now been canceled which is saving money. Easy to use and connect to internet. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Catsgranny

customer_reviews.title: Good, but not quite great.
customer_reviews.text: It's nice for what it does, but if you're expecting it to be fast then you will be disappointed. I'm often left wondering whether I have actually pressed the button on the remote or whether i'm still waiting for it to go through. Despite it being a handy size, there are better android based devices out there which pack more of a punch than the Amazon Fire Stick's offering. Consider the Fire TV for a better experience if you want to use the device for more than just amazon streaming.
customer_reviews.author: R. M. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Good but not quite there
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to give me extra channels not provided by Roku. Gives a lot more but incapable of maintaining sound and video synchronisation. It may have something to do with our relatively poor internet connection but if not needs some serious work. Look forward to some response. Biggest failure is the inability to pick up a programme from where it left off. Also if you switch back to tv it cannot return without being physically disconnected from power and tv powered down. Love Grand Tour!!!
customer_reviews.author: J. Marsh

customer_reviews.title: Wi-Fi Unreliable - Screen Mirror Did not work
customer_reviews.text: Having had great success with Google Chromecast I bought this for my main TV which on paper looked more sophisticated. Other reviewers comments on the streaming facilities are more valid than mine. My biggest disappointment was the Screen Casting (Mirroring) just did not work, neither on my Tablet nor my Samsung Smartphone. Following hours and days trying to find a solution, trying all sorts, I had to give up. It appears I am not alone with this issue. In the end I returned the and went for the trusted Chromecast. Issues with your particular Router, Tablet or Smartphone could hold the gremlins. I acknowledge the majority of reviewers are quite satisfied, particularly the streamers and the like.
customer_reviews.author: Peter White

customer_reviews.title: ... couldn't believe the fast delivery of this it was fantastic. When I got it I got it for ...
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't believe the fast delivery of this it was fantastic. When I got it I got it for the bedroom and when I plugged it in I got a bit confused at first (that could have been my alzheimers). Eventually I plugged it in right and all programmes cam on and was brilliant picture. I was a bit disappointed at the fact that you have to pay for some tv series but I not sure if it the same for any movies, I not checked that. Other than the fact u got to pay for some, which I won't, then it simple and easy to use and I have Amazon video on my iPad as well.
customer_reviews.author: Karen King

customer_reviews.title: Glitchy, buggy, a bit crap
customer_reviews.text: Freezes up, goes to sleep and refuses to wake without total reboot. It changes the TV input at least a couple of times a day. Overall it's not as good as the old one we have upstairs we have had for years. Amazon quality control is dreadful but hey we knew that going in so it was expected, there is nothing at the price range better though so... We buy most stuff from ebay these days but in this case it was unavoidable.
customer_reviews.author: BorisTheBlade

customer_reviews.title: Worked erratically and now not working at all!!
customer_reviews.text: As I write, my Fire Stick has stopped working, and I have only been using it for 9 days!! Ridiculous. And when it was working the picture would cut out for one to two seconds numerous times throughout the day, especially at key moments during this year's US Open, which was the only reason I decided to use my Fire Stick. Also apps like Al Jazeera are not stable - granted, it could be the fault of the app developers - but for whatever reason the app and the Fire Stick are incompatible. Very disappointed and will discontinue my free month's trial of Amazon Prime, along with discarding the Fire Stick altogether. Not a great product in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: vampira

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable waste of money - buy a Roku
customer_reviews.text: Remote stopped working after a few weeks and had to order a replacement. Then Amazon decided to fall out with Google, so I can no longer use YouTube on this thing, which was the only other thing I used it for besides Netflix. Now it's been glitching all over the place for the last couple months, making it impossible to watch anything for more than 10 minutes before it freezes, so it barely lasted a year and a half over all. I've bought myself a Roku instead, which, even at £10 cheaper than the Firestick, is a much faster, slicker user experience and has a much wider range of apps available too. Thanks for absolutely nothing, Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Darren

customer_reviews.title: Perfect if you have Amazon Prime
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised at how quick the fire stick runs. Navigating through the menus is smooth and intuitive. The streaming is really quick and using the other apps such as Netflix and Spotify work perfectly. I am really impressed at how the prime videos are part of the main menu screen making it an enjoyable experience browsing through the films. I have a tivo box that has netflix and other apps included and compared to the Fire Stick it's just painful. Well worth the money if you already have Amazon prime, even if you don't there are a lot of other apps on the marketplace you can make use of. For such a small device it performs incredibly well!
customer_reviews.author: Rob Turner

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant bit of kit.
customer_reviews.text: I have been mulling over and researching various modes of getting films since all our local DVD stores closed down. Watching TV is mine and hubby's 'going out' these days, as actually going out is too expensive. I found this so easy to set up and I was scanning through the vast library of films, TV series and all the other stuff you get for such a small annual or monthly fee in about 15 minutes of opening the box. Very, very happy with the Fire Stick, and will be recommending it to all my friends and family.
customer_reviews.author: S. A. Humphrey

customer_reviews.title: Oops!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent doing what it's supposed to. There is a problem with it though. That is you need to subscribe to Amazon Prime to get the majority of what I was expecting. Had a problem though - not the Firesticks fault. Discovered after I had it for several months that my TV had Amazon built in. So I had wasted money buying an item I did not need. Plonker! So because it did not let me watch the channels I thought I would get for the price of the Firestick I only give it three stars.
customer_reviews.author: N.O.T. Philips

customer_reviews.title: one can mirror/screencast from a smart device to overcome this issue
customer_reviews.text: Definitely enjoying experiencing new technologies, and had high expectations of this Fire TV Stick product. But perhaps a little too high. It has many advantages, but lets concentrate on one major disadvantage: it does not allow me direct access to the internet. This means I cannot access any other content I have hosted on other sites/apps. And yes, one can mirror/screencast from a smart device to overcome this issue, but I don't think this is as convenient. To be fair, this is an early review and through time, I may be in a better position to confirm its full capabilities.
customer_reviews.author: T. Tran

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Prefer this over my Fire TV, which stopped working when we change our network set-up. This works just fine - I suspect it has a different TCP/IP stack, as it supports signing on to WiFi services like those you might find in a hotel. I'm using it with the USB power supplied by my TV's USB port, and despite the stick complaining the power was insufficient, I've noticed no problems. If I were to buy this again, I would opt for the model with the microphone remote; that's the only feature of the FireTV I miss.
customer_reviews.author: James John Osborne

customer_reviews.title: Best Streaming Device, yet
customer_reviews.text: Superb Pros - IPlayer, Youtube, Manga - means extra channels with only 1 cost. I've enjoyed shows I used to watch has a kid, all without needing to replace my TV or watching it on a laptop. Cons - No 4 onDemand (yet) , some people may be annoyed by need to use circular pad to use on screen keyboard to enter text.) Our internet speed is slow, yet the Apps run well (BBC Player can be annoying with buffering at peak times....sometimes not !), so I cannot comment on Amazon Prime , however the other apps Manga, Tubi TV, Youtube - have ran movies, tv shows with no buffering and at high quality
customer_reviews.author: Scorpious's PA

customer_reviews.title: Where is the 2nd generation for the UK?
customer_reviews.text: Replaced an aging atom based HTPC with this. Installed Kodi, paired my existing bluetooth keyboard and mouse, installed the remote app on my phone and I don't really miss anything from the PC with this stick, which is much smaller and has less cables. Plus I get to watch my amazon prime content. Overall, very pleased. The UI sometimes lags but I guess that's down to the bargain basement hardware spec. I see there's a more powerful 2nd generation version available in the U.S but not the UK. Why? Hence 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Nelly

customer_reviews.title: Fire Stick - a doddle to set up
customer_reviews.text: Received my Fire Stick today. It took all of 5 minutes to install and set up, it was an absolute doddle. I have a BT Home Hub and the wi-fi paired with the Fire Stick with no problems. I have a Samsung tv and had hoped to be able to power the Fire Stick via a tv USB port but an on screen message informed me there was insufficient power so had to resort to the power cable supplied. There are loads of excellent free programmes, films and music available to stream through Prime. My one disappointment is that I can't download music, to play in my car, as part of the package.
customer_reviews.author: Hoarsefly

customer_reviews.title: Handy but flawed
customer_reviews.text: After 4 months of use, I've generally come to appreciate it. But it has flaws:- 1) taking it to another house and trying to configure it there for use on another person's TV took about an hour of trial and error and requires creation of a WiFi hotspot that mimiced the original WiFi network it was connected to. 2) once voice control was activated it proved impossible to switch off and unusable thereafter. In both cases I was using the Android app to control. Hopefully taking it back home and to the handset control will allow me to switch off the voice control.
customer_reviews.author: Taka

customer_reviews.title: Remember dial up? Well this is some unwanted nostalgia
customer_reviews.text: Awful. Constantly drops off Wi-Fi despite every other device in the house working fine. This often happens just as getting into a film or series. Won't pick up our stronger Wi-Fi connection at all. Also then affects others apps on the device (Netflix etc). At least Netflix has a tv channel that I can watch it on. Heats like a bugger as well. Sometimes not sure what I'm paying a subscription for as its not to watch seamless tv.
customer_reviews.author: Flash Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Excellent piece of kit
customer_reviews.text: Can't really complain about this. It works really well and is easy to use. Quality is really good and the streaming is very reliable. It helps that I have a good broadband. It's nice and compact. It does need a power source so might be awkward for something people to set up. All popular streaming channels and apps are available. Otherwise it's highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Cloud

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: A little spanker! Loaded in straight away to the TV, the hardest part was squeezing behind the TV to find the socket. You do need Amazon Prime or you are wasting your time with this. There are a decent selection of Films and TV Series. The picture quality is good, almost HD - but this does depend on the strength of the internet signal. We do not have a brilliant signal (despite Virgin saying they are the Bees Knees) and sometimes the picture pixilates and stops for a couple of minutes. You cannot save anything to the stick, it is totally streamed to the TV. I can recommend. Overall a good purchase for the price and I can recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Joannie

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bit of kit.
customer_reviews.text: These have to be one of the best gadgets out there, combined with a prime account they really are amazing value, to be fair great value even if you don't, you access to various TV channels, apps, you can watch or listen to any of your purchased digital films, music or books. Compact in size, no subscription fees, works on any TV with a free HDMI port, has a remote control (batteries supplied), and more. After showing my friends and family they have asked me to get them one too, and they are all techno phoebes lol. Think I have purchased about five of these so far. Originally purchased my first one after reading all of the great reviews online.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. J. P. Stevenson

customer_reviews.title: That is of course is the theory in practice we kept getting "internet connection" errors despite having great internet signal so
customer_reviews.text: In theory the fire stick is a simple and cheap way of getting bbc iplayer, amazon prime, youtuben etc through your tv, all you need is in the box plug it in and your ready to go. That is of course is the theory in practice we kept getting "internet connection" errors despite having great internet signal so ready to go we where not. .This was simply fixed by buying a Amazon Fire TV Stick Extension Cable/Lead to stop the connection being lost behind the tv but this little £5 cable should be included in the original purchase in my opinion not something you have to buy separately.
customer_reviews.author: CJ.D

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with the performance and picture quality
customer_reviews.text: Worked straight out of the box on Samsung TV. I downloaded latest firmware from Samsung web site and upgraded TV before installing Firestick. Connected straight away to TV then followed on screen instructions. No problems with connectivity at all. Only 4 stars because the unit gets very hot when in use and putting it into sleep mode is fiddly and time consuming. Very pleased with the performance and picture quality. Now if only I can find a way to delete Clarkson I will reinstate fifth star.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Graham

customer_reviews.title: I can confirm that the Firestick is very poor at picking up WiFi
customer_reviews.text: Just changed my review. Read below for my original review. Having now changed ISP, I can confirm that the Firestick is very poor at picking up WiFi. Everything I watch just buffers. My Netflix app plays video very poorly pixelated. My TV has built in Netflix. This connects and plays fine. Personally, I wish I'd not bothered now. My previous review was 4/5 and read- I've not gone full 5 star as the device keeps buffering. However, I believe this has more to do with my awful TalkTalk internet service...although it doesn't do it on Netflix. I've changed ISP's and am waiting to be switched over. If it resolves this buffering issue, I will up this score to 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: ori-STUDFARM

customer_reviews.title: Good gift. The whole family use it when visiting!
customer_reviews.text: Gift for my Mam she likes it as she can only get Terrestrial TV doenstairs due to the trees blocking satelite signals. Using this means she can use the BBC and other catchup setvices. She does find it a bit complicated though so perhaps I'll upgrade the remote to a voice one soon. We all use it to watch films and bix sets on my Prime when we visit her.
customer_reviews.author: Hedzy

customer_reviews.title: SOLUTION TO A PROBLEM
customer_reviews.text: I had been using signal transmission from my WiFi router, via the mains circuit, to my TV to access BBC iplayer. The BBC changed this availability at the end of September and I could no longer connect. As I do not have a 'smart' TV or subscribe to a service package from a network provider I was left with a problem. The Fire Stick provided the solution. It also contains connection to many TV channels and others services on subscription, such as Netflix if these are wanted. The set-up has a clear information guide that I was able to follow without too much difficulty.
customer_reviews.author: Richard C.

customer_reviews.title: Remote is broken after 1 week/  "Don't use for recommendation" Dose Not work
customer_reviews.text: Remote is broke after 1 week constant scrolling in direction you press I use and app on my mob' phone as remote instead. but had to first setup using remote. Had to pick letters fast before it started scrolling and if had to delete a letter all was deleted because of this fault. i would not but another one. Not worth the price. Removing a watch next program from list they come back... Prime - I deleted "over 500" all watch next and recommended Movies/Documentaries ect and "Don't use for recommendation" still get crap about UFO's and conspiracy theories. I'm sick of it and will not be renewing my subscription.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better installation guide/instructions needed!
customer_reviews.text: Once we got it working great but have to say that there were no directions on how to install. It said in all the adverts just plug in and your off! That's just not the case. We spent 2 hours on a call to the Amazon technical team who could not fathom it out either and we were constantly put on hold while the assistant tried to resolve the problem! We eventually fathomed it out ourselves by going into the HDMI section on our smart tv. Thankfully it is now working great. But due to the poor installation instructions we have only given a 3 star!
customer_reviews.author: Molly

customer_reviews.title: Love This
customer_reviews.text: Loving this Voice Remote Fire Stick , I am far from tech minded but managed to plug the stick and lead in and to my great surprise it worked straight away , no one could have been more gob smacked than me as I am really useless as I said at tech. The voice remote was amazing ,I kept expecting it to come up with "I'm sorry but I didn't quite get that" but it got me first time every time. I downloaded the BBC eye player and am now looking forward to watching some decent films when I get the time. Plus I purchased this on an offer it had £10 0ff so was only £35 ,great bargain.
customer_reviews.author: MARIE

customer_reviews.title: Great Device
customer_reviews.text: If you have a BT Home Hub this is not the easiest thing to set up. At first all I could get to work was BBC iPlayer, which I already have on mhy Kindle Fire Tablet, so I was thinking about sending this back. However, one telephone call to the Amazon Help Team, who were amazingly patient and talked me through what I had to do, and now everything works perfectly. Very pleased with it. However, as it would seem this is a common problem, I wondered why they did not add a paragraph in the literature about how to make this device work with the BT Home Hub..
customer_reviews.author: H McLeod

customer_reviews.title: V poor wifi
customer_reviews.text: Got a couple of these and unless you are a few feet from the Wi-Fi box the stream quality is very poor. They should have a separate aerial but it's built in to the stick and they only provide a v. Short HDMI extension so the stick is jammed up against the back of the tv and obviously gets little signal especially if your tv is wall mounted. Rest of the features are fine but poor reception can make it very frustrating to use.
customer_reviews.author: Limulus

customer_reviews.title: Okay device, but not for me
customer_reviews.text: Great little device, however playback would be interrupted at times with an odd glitchy beep. I presume this is due to bandwidth constraints, however other devices use our 28Mbps download without buffering (in HD). I wonder if the stick is under powered or if mine was faulty; either way returned for refund. The voice search facility was a fun feature, although after the initial novelty wore off (and favourite series' favourited!) it was not used much. I have a QNAP with media playback capabilities which I've returned to using, although I may consider a Fire TV in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Lemony

customer_reviews.title: Constant network problems (when there are no network issues!)
customer_reviews.text: Good when it works but invariably it doesn't. Almost every time we turn it on there is a 'network problem'. We have to switch to a different wifi network and then go back to ours and if we're lucky, it will work. On average it takes 10 mins to get it up and running and quite often it stops working when watching a programme. When we have issues the wifi network tests normal and is running at 25mbit speeds. So, v frustrating and near to throwing it in the bin. Not sure I'll try another fire stick.
customer_reviews.author: Dips

customer_reviews.title: extra choice viewing
customer_reviews.text: I have dithered about purchasing one of these Firesticks for a while, now with unlimited broadband (essential) and prime membership I took the plunge. It was one of the best decisions I have made with a very wide choice of films, music, drama and Amazon series I am thrilled with the choice. Setting it up took just a few minutes and a short film explained the remote functions, with terrible Christmas programs most probably showing again I have a diverse choice of entertainment on hand and if partying enough music to satisfy all. A good bit of technology to have.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. C. Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Kodi installed and ran fine as-per the instructions on the Kodi website
customer_reviews.text: Compared with the full fire TV (which I had first) the stick is less responsive, but apart from that it works well. The cheaper remote is OK but seems to have more aggressive power saving, so it sometimes takes a few button presses to power on the TV (attached and controlled by CEC). It is also a bit blocky and definitely less stylish than the voice remote, so I would spend a bit more for it! Kodi installed and ran fine as-per the instructions on the Kodi website.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Notley

customer_reviews.title: Be aware of the cable length.
customer_reviews.text: Simple set up and connection to wifi. Using with an upstairs room t.v. with the router downstairs. No problems whatsoever with wifi signal. It is plugged directly into a rear hdmi socket and I was surprisd that the remote control works perfectly well. I am a Prime member so this is useful for watching stuff there and also catch up t.v. etc.. There's a good selection of apps available too. The t.v. is wall mounted and the power outlet socket is just above skirting board level resulting in the supplied u.s.b. cable being just long enough. If the t.v. were that bit higher off the ground then it would have been necessary to purchase a longer u.s.b. power cable.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Blobby.

customer_reviews.title: Everything you've heard about it is true.
customer_reviews.text: This device is superb. There is nothing else you need to know. If you have an Amazon account, Netflix, Spotify or any interest in watching films in another room without complexity, this is the kiddy. I sometimes forget that its such a simple device as the user experience is great. If you're one of those 'freeloaders' Kodi is also possible through a simple process to side-load the app. YouTube is your friend with advice on that.
customer_reviews.author: Rev. Mac

customer_reviews.title: Must-have for an amazon prime member
customer_reviews.text: As an amazon prime member this is pretty much essential kit. It does far more than ive worked out so far, but essentially it lets you do all your amazon prime stuff on your TV, and lets you download other apps like vevo and youtube as well. The remote is really well designed. Because Amazon designed both the remote AND the menu system, you end up being able to navigate around with a remote with very few keys. Other manufacturers should learn from this. If you watch Amazon Prime video, this does exactly what it says on the tin.
customer_reviews.author: Son of Sam

customer_reviews.title: MASSIVE FLAW FOR PARENTS
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to put amazon tv in my daughters room. Only upon receiving it did I find out you cant add age restrictions on content - unlike every other device amazon sells. BE WARNED - none of the material I found online prior to buying this stated this massive flaw. All suggest you can add parental controls - which you can of a sort. You can make it so you have to put a pin in before watching ANYTHING - which is about as useful as a chocolate teapot. Unable to test beyond this as returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. Have so far watched a season & a half of Game of Thrones and a couple of films through this device on and HD (but not a smart) TV. It has streamed with no problems at all, in HD and very fast response to remote, also syncs with my Fire tablet with regards to last watched & jumping off points etc.. Have browsed my own collection of photos & videos from the cloud - perfect. Taken a look at the games and catch up services, all very easy to access & use. Screen mirroring also works a treat. Nice product, happy I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: L. M. Stephens

customer_reviews.title: Better value than Sky but still needs more content to get 5 starts
customer_reviews.text: Had this for about 3 months after getting rid of Sky TV. Definitely only worth it if you have Prime, with some good shows and movies available. As a piece of kit it is easy to install and works very well, the main thing is the volume and quality of the content available. If they can continue to increase this it will be excellent. Use it to access Netflix as they offer greater content, hopefully one way the Amazon content will surpass Netflix and I can then get rid of Netflix to save a bit more money. Definitely better value than Sky, especially if you find you don't watch programmes live very often so Iplayer type set up is fine.
customer_reviews.author: Mark R

customer_reviews.title: I like the fire stick
customer_reviews.text: So the Amazon fire stick allows you to watch Amazon Prime Instant Video, BBC iPlayer, ITV Player and Netflix. You can also play music from online services like spotify or YouTube. You can also download Kodi onto the fire stick which I think most people do. You will need wifi for the fire stick to work and I do think you get more benefits from the stick if you are subscribed to Amazon prime. I am not really gadget savvy but I was able to set this up within minutes. We have used it also since buying it and have found that we do not watch as much normal t.v as we are often watching stuff on the fire stick
customer_reviews.author: Lisa O

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed with the fire stick don't really get much free
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed with the fire stick don't really get much free. I thought it would be good to get the stuff that wasn't showed on sky catch-up without having to pay a lot for.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn

customer_reviews.title: Do not Bother with this one, Save your money
customer_reviews.text: Don't bother, Total waste of money. I have tried on two different Tvs an does not work on either. I wonder if the device needs connecting to something else other than the TV, in which case it should say so. I am about to return, unless some one knows what I am doing wrong, the description says simply plug the item in and away you go and does not mention anywhere the need for a degree in science. Very disappointed because this has spoiled Amazons up to now excellent record with me
customer_reviews.author: Stargate Cafe (Consignment)

customer_reviews.title: Love it. All my TV and movie apps in ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it. All my TV and movie apps in one place plugged into my TV. No need for my laptop or tablet to be plugged in anymore. Great and super fast. Occasionally needs to be unplugged and replugged. Also for my TV the stick needs to be plugged into the mains too. Highly recommended if you love prime and are a prime member and have Netflix.
customer_reviews.author: auspicious

customer_reviews.title: Take full advantage of your existing Prime membership
customer_reviews.text: Amazon Prime is a handy alternative for those evenings when there's 'nothing on the telly'. The Fire TV Stick itself easily deserves 5 stars; a great little gadget, streams video seamlessly and very straightforward to set up & use. The reason for only 4 stars overall is that I'm not sure I could (personally) justify the annual Prime fee for the TV service alone but, as the primary reason for subscribing was to take advantage of next-day Amazon delivery, the addition of Fire TV is a nice fringe benefit. NOTE: I would only recommend it to people who have unlimited broadband... I would imagine that regular video streaming would soon eat up your limited data allowance?
customer_reviews.author: Chris O'Brien

customer_reviews.title: This little Fire Stick works very well. However,...
customer_reviews.text: This little Fire Stick works very well. However, I had hoped that I would be able to access a massive library of films and TV shows. The range of stuff accessible is much more limited than I had anticipated so, in that respect, it's something of a disappointment. Amazon Prime isn't cheap and it would be good if a library of classic & quality films could be accessed without further cost.
customer_reviews.author: Old Sid

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT PIECE OF EQUIPMENT
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this on Black Friday and have been using it since it arrived the following day! It`s better than I imagined it would be and worked straight out of the box! My previous tele box had to be connected by lead so I was unsure how this wireless version would work, needn`t have worried it picked up the wireless signal from the router no problem. (The router is in the hall whilst the living is at the back of the bungalow) All the apps work great, with no "buffering" at all. ( I do use the short extension lead as recommended by another reviewer.) I cannot recommend this highly enough - just get one you won`t be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: P. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic little device! Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.text: What a great device this is. All my favourite streaming serviced in one place, plus some very fun games! It is very simple to use, which is helpful when you have older generations who want to use it who sometimes struggle with how complicated tech can be today. I highly recommend getting this is you have Prime and/or Netflix. It's also really great for Spotify. And I LOVE the trivia games!
customer_reviews.author: Harlequin864

customer_reviews.title: Briliant
customer_reviews.text: I love this, it really is easy just plug into HDMI port on back of TV and enter your details using the remote and your ready to go , i thought it would be harder i have installed You tube and i love the music sections you can pick and choose which songs you want , There are movies and tv shows you can watch for free if you are a member of Prime. What else can i say there is something for the whole family.
customer_reviews.author: dumpling

customer_reviews.title: Just stopped working with no use at all
customer_reviews.text: I had this plugged into the tv and the power was sometimes on and mostly not on....it's completely dead after trying to put it to use. It did start up when I first got it a couple of years ago (that I can remember) but I never used it at all!! I've tried the power cord from a newer version of the stick (supplies enough juice) and tried different TVs and with and without the HDMI extension....nothing at all.
customer_reviews.author: Sirius76

customer_reviews.title: ... item for over a year and now and really like it alot it has not given me any trouble ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had this item for over a year and now and really like it alot it has not given me any trouble at all, But recently the fire stick has all of a sudden stopped working I have changed the batteries but still it does not work. I have a remote that has a Netflix button on it so I am able to still use Netflix. Can you please let me know what is wrong with the Fire stick thank you
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stick was great when we first got it however it has started ...
customer_reviews.text: We have a first generation fire stick which is used in replacement of an aerial to watch tv in our bedroom. Stick was great when we first got it however it has started to run slower than expected which comes with the age of the product, however it does still do the job intended and is great for watching catchup tv or some live tv via certain apps. I also love the fire tv app which can be used to control the fire stick. For the price of the device you can’t complain at all about it! Teamed up with prime it’s great for watching prime tv
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Williams

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant gizmo .. fast, cheap and brilliant quality.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely brilliant little gizmo .. immediately turned a non-smart TV into a smart TV, made all my content available without any fuss, logged me straight into my Amazon Prime account (I didn't seem to need to do anything .. it just new it was me!?). Has to be one of the best value devices around. Faster access to content than with my other 'built in' smart TV. I would thoroughly recommend this (you'll need a spare HDMI input, and a power connection nearby to power it up (if your TV doesn't have a USB output of sufficient power - mine didn't .. but this came with everything I needed to get it all up and working)
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would it work with my Projector!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely Brilliant, I purchased this to use with my home Projector, so that i could watch my Prime Movies on the big screen. It has not disappointed me in any way. like most Amazon branded products, it just works right out of the Box. if you looking for a reasonably priced Gift for Christmas and have a TV or in my case Projector and you don't need to upgrade either by buying a new TV. then this is an economical option to upgrade your TV all you need is a HDMI Port and your done. The remote control lAmazon App for your Smart Phone available Free, from the relevant Appstore is an added bonus and makes life easy too.
customer_reviews.author: nigel graham

customer_reviews.title: Poor effort from Amazon! Don’t buy it!
customer_reviews.text: Too expensive for what it is! Processor is far too slow, there is a repeated misalignment between sound and vision. Disappointing! Update. Software was updated. Since Amazon introduced video previews in the interface, this stick is rendered useless! Navigation is now extremely slow, when it works. Keeps freezing after a little use. I will cancel my subscription!
customer_reviews.author: Optimus Grime

customer_reviews.title: Worked better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Worked a lot better than expected. I had been using either a tablet or a laptop to stream films from Amazon, but there was always a bit of 'buffering', particularly on sweeping, panning shots. Streaming was distinctly inferior to playing DVDs. This is despite measuring actual download speeds on those devices in that location of more than 10 times what Amazon said was required. However, streaming works much better with the Fire Stick, and it's much more convenient to just stick it in an HDMI port and leave it there than it is to move tablets or laptops, connect them with cables and navigate to the appropriate page.
customer_reviews.author: mapreader

customer_reviews.title: Turns any tv into a smart tv!
customer_reviews.text: I had some trouble installing this at first, but a quick call to amazon helpline fixed the problems I was having. Their customer care team is amazing. Theres an amazing selection of films and tv to watch through amazon prime tv. Its the ideal addition to your tv to turn into a smart tv. You can access all the major smart TV features (Netflix) and playback shows from BBC, ITV, Channel 4 and Channel 5. We were planning to buy a new smart tv to replace our current one, but this fire tv stick does the same job at a much cheaper price.
customer_reviews.author: Ms Zhang

customer_reviews.title: Best device I have used.
customer_reviews.text: Really pleased with this. I had tried other devices for digital interactive tv, but these were clunky and only worked plugged into my tv. This Amazon Fire TV stick works faultlessly plugged into my Amp so now I can watch everything in 5.1 surround sound and stream music with exceptional quality; possibly a little bass heavy and none of my amps pre sets iron this out so I'll need to set up some custom equaliser settings to balance the sound. But this dongle is by far the best device I have used yet. The remote and system is all very intuitive too. Brilliant, highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Darren I

customer_reviews.title: On Fire ... the future of TV content?
customer_reviews.text: Recommended by a friend and definitely worth the purchase price. Grand Tour is excellent. Two tips; if you plug the Fire Stick into your TV and you have a surround sound system fed via a cable box, you will need a dual phono lead back from the TV to the audio system, to enable Dolby audio. Secondly, even with Prime membership, box sets have a purchase price, so don't get caught out as I did! Really good piece of kit, though. Did I mention how good Grand Tour is......?
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Fell

customer_reviews.title: These products from amazon are by far the better working out of all the ones I have tried
customer_reviews.text: Having used both the Fire stick and the larger alternative I can honestly say that Amazon has got it right. I have tried several alternative android computers to be able to watch tv. These products from amazon are by far the better working out of all the ones I have tried. I recommend getting the larger one but if it is outside your price range the fire stick will do nicely. Only thing I didn't like about it is that it still needs to be plugged in.
customer_reviews.author: David Santander

customer_reviews.title: What can I say just brilliant love my Fire TV Stick
customer_reviews.text: What can I say just brilliant love my Fire TV Stick, its so convenient for watching numerous channels, easy to move to another TV if needed, I would be lost without my Fire TV Stick now. Price very reasonable have since purchase more, arrived next day, packaged really well. Also lots of information from Amazon regarding setting up or any problems you may occur. Would definitely recommend purchasing a Fire TV Stick.
customer_reviews.author: Lizzy

customer_reviews.title: Really good
customer_reviews.text: I normally have Netflix and Amazon on my little tablet, but decided to upgrade to this on my big screen. SO HAPPY I did. I don't have to have my computers on making noise, just my tv now. I take it travelling with me sometimes too if there's wifi. I ordered the normal controller, but I think it's worth paying a bit more for the voice controller to make searching less frustrating. So if you're like me and prefer to stream stuff in your own time and don't watch much tv (or have a busy schedule that makes you miss stuff), I highly recommend this (if you have a fast enough and stable enough wifi connection).
customer_reviews.author: Vicky B

customer_reviews.title: I really wish this thing had an adblocker. I ...
customer_reviews.text: I really wish this thing had an adblocker. I know content creators have to be paid but it seems to give up playing videos in the YouTube "app" after an advert runs at the end of an episode. I say "app" as it's not really a fully fledged app, it just loads youtube.com/tv so this is probably more a YouTube issue than a Fire Stick issue but that's what I mostly use it for so it affects my review. The native apps I've run on it (Netflix, Plex, Twitch) have all run perfectly. It's just the lack of a native YouTube app that lets this down a tiny bit.
customer_reviews.author: C. Robo

customer_reviews.title: Best Christmas present I've recently bought myself.....
customer_reviews.text: I've been using a Chromecast for a while as I can also use it for work-based presentations, however after buying the Fire stick for home use, there's no going back. The choice of programmes appears almost limitless, and the wifi performance in the first 4 weeks has been completely flawless, in spite of being on a very slow network. This device is very simple to install and use! If you're a prime member already, and aren't streaming, in my opinion, this is the best unit to purchase. Why not 5 stars? Because as yet I can't get my Sonos speakers working in conjunction with the Fire stick. I'm sure this will come in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Not sure how we managed without it!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to go in a living room at uni because we don't have a TV aerial. So easy to set up and get started. Lovely interface - even my technophone dad managed to use it when he came over to visit. Obviously works best with a prime account, which we have. Good choice of apps - our favs are Netflix/BBC iPlayer/TV Player which lets you watch live TV. The Spotify and YouTube apps are brilliant as well so we can just have music on in the background. Would be great if it supported NowTV as well but maybe in the future.
customer_reviews.author: N. A.

customer_reviews.title: Very useful!
customer_reviews.text: As someone who doesn't have an external aerial for a TV, this is a lifesaver! you can download apps to let you watch all of the standard programmes, a well as netflix and amazon prime if you already pay for those. You can also pay for films/tv shows to rent or buy, and buy games etc. The fire stick is very easy to set up and use, as long as you tv has a HDMI port, also you can download an app on your phone that lets you use your phone as the remote control. Very useful if you tend to lose the remote!
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: Small but works incredibly well!
customer_reviews.text: Had a google chromecast before but this is in another league, so much easier to use set up in minutes and i didn't need a degree in computers to work it out! The picture is so good even though we only have 2mbps . The remote is small but very well designed(although easily lost) The system of indexing is easy to follow and easy to download apps . Delighted in every aspect of this little fellow that packs such a punch
customer_reviews.author: Arnie

customer_reviews.title: Easy peasy Firestick.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great gizmo, easy peasy to plug and play. Our internet connection seems to be fast enough to allow the Firestick to work well with only a couple of episodes of buffering. The picture Quality is excellent There is a great variety of programming available. This is a good way to catch up on programmes your really want to see. The remote is quite tricky to get used to and is not intuitive. I was a Sky customer but it became too expensive. I think Firestick is a good option to try as long as your internet connection is fast enough.
customer_reviews.author: jcbee

customer_reviews.title: Great to start with, performance has gone downhill since...
customer_reviews.text: Bought a FireStick for Black Friday 2016 and up until recently, loved it. But ever since Amazon released their new version with voice remote as standard, I’ve noticed the performance of mine has taken a dive! Apps frequently crash with no reason, video cuts out and fails to buffer (not due to my internet connection, believe me) and the performance of the stick generally is sluggish and unreliable. I guess this is all because Amazon want us to upgrade to their newer model, which is a shame, because, as a Prime customer, I’d expect to get a bit more than 15 months out of one of Amazon’s headline product! Might be time to consider a Chromecast instead...
customer_reviews.author: Freyr

customer_reviews.title: YOU HAVE TO PAY TO WATCH ANYTHING DECENT
customer_reviews.text: If you can actually find a decent series or film you have to pay to view it. This is not made clear in the advertising. Also the software is very cliché. Everytime I want to watch a film I access the software only to find something is greyed out and end up on the phone for ages trying to sort it out with Amazon. This product is not worth it and can ruin your evening!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: NOT SUITABLE FOR SINGLE LIVING PENSIONERS.
customer_reviews.text: I give this rating because it's falsely advertised, as none of the ads on TV or cinema does it mention or show the need to connect to mains electricity. Also it does no more than a Smart TV/Blu-Ray player or a TV box. It's just a channel for Amazon to rip off people by selling over priced media. I am a pensioner and do NOT have to pay TV license so on a small pension living on my own where would I find money to waste on one off viewing? It was a gift that family did not investigate details before purchase, and as me were fooled by advert into thinking it was easy plug and play.
customer_reviews.author: M. Kraft

customer_reviews.title: to be honest it's one of the better presents that I have ever had
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas present from one of my sons and his partner, to be honest it's one of the better presents that I have ever had. So much choice of films, tv shows and programmes. Very easy to use via the neat remote control which accompanies it. Just had a few minor glitches on some of the tv shows, nothing major and easily remedied.I have spent almost all of my viewing time via the Amazon Fire stick , with just a couple of breaks back to Sky news or BBC news, well that say's it all really. A real Winner from Amazon, every home should have one - just so glad mine does.
customer_reviews.author: Crofty756

customer_reviews.title: This thing is useless at screen mirroring
customer_reviews.text: This thing is useless at screen mirroring. My Samsung phone works, my nexus 7 tablet doesn't, my amazon fire 7 inch 5th gen tablet doesn't. The AMAZON remote app works on some devices but not on others, it seems to be completely random whether the device can find the fire stick or not. Sometimes yes sometimes no. The android devices are all on 5.1.1 at least. All my equipment is in the same room. The only device which can screen mirror to the fire stick is a Samsung phone, even though al the other devices are capable of mirroring. The other functions seem OK, but so what? How much G**D***** TV a person watch? For screen casting/mirroring look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Careful

customer_reviews.title: Watching what I want when I want.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the firestick as someone had bought me a subscription to netflix and I wanted to use it to view films and TV series on my Tv instead of on my computer screen. This worked fantastically and was easy to set up. I also then realised that I could watch things like bbc i player , the itv hub my 5 and all 4. Bonus! I have been a little confused by the whole amazon prime thing and the fact that some things are available but require payment. I have steered away from these for now and everything I watch is free. Really glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Helen Keighley

customer_reviews.title: For Everybody
customer_reviews.text: Probably one of the best gifts to get as a present, no matter what age. The product is easily adaptable and has an interface which literally anybody could use. This could mean it could make a present for an older family member who is in need of something extra for ther house. As it comes you get the basic Amazon apps already installed. This doesn't mean you cannot get other channels. Simply search for what you need and download it. I would recommendthis to anyone for themselves or for a present.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Hughes-Stainsby

customer_reviews.title: A useful addition to any TV.
customer_reviews.text: Ridiculously easy to set up and use. Access to all the major TV and movie apps (i.e. BBC, ITV, Channel 4, Channel 5, Netflix, Amazon, etc.) Somewhat useful without an Amazon Prime account (this stick will make a "normal" TV into a "smart" TV), though it really comes alive when coupled with an Amazon Prime account (i.e. loads more TV shows and movies). Make sure you have decent Wi-Fi broadband before buying this, as it will buffer like hell with a slow connection.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to watch my favourite Amazon only TV shows on our TV instead of iPad. I decided to take a chance and buy the Firestick. It was so easy to install after following the instructions. Within about 10 minutes it was up and running. The picture quality is amazing and there is no buffering during playback. I am glad that I chose th voice activated remote as it makes it easy to find the program that I want to watch. Another bonus is that one can take it away on holiday and get th benefit on rainy days. In conclusion, this is a wonderful product which I have no hesitation in recommending to other consumers.
customer_reviews.author: DWT

customer_reviews.title: Your password will be found out and here's how.
customer_reviews.text: It's great on my TV but every time I change the password my daughters work it out (within 3 presses of it). So, what's the secret. My youngest finally told me. When you press the numbers the corresponding areas on the screen fade a little. They have to look at it carefully and it does take a few goes but they can see it. You need to be very careful when you put it in. Kids are clever little ............ Other than that we've really enjoyed watching a lot of different shows and films
customer_reviews.author: DanthePoppy

customer_reviews.title: It gets so much better
customer_reviews.text: I just wish I could remove many of the pre-installs, use cloud based storage for downloads and have a decent keyboard. The controller misses all the right buttons but using the phone app helps a little. Still unable to select red, blue yellow or green and some built in mouse feature would be a massive advantage
customer_reviews.author: Happyisseb

customer_reviews.title: A troublesome start, but working well so far. Worthy of a purchase, given the broad content.
customer_reviews.text: Not so straightforward to set-up, as the stick wouldn't default to English when scrolling through the language options. For a company that is American where they speak (a form of) English, you'd have thought that would be the first option. It wasn't. The default first option happened to be German and regrettably, I cannot speak that. French & Spanish I'd have been able to handle somewhat...but anyway - once eventually set-up (20 minutes later and 6 re-boots/re-starts), I achieved set-up and it is now working well.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. B. Scott

customer_reviews.title: not used very often as I don't have great broadband speed
customer_reviews.text: bought this item 6 months ago, not used very often as I don't have great broadband speed. It no longer works.It wont switch on unless I remove it from the back of the TV then re-install it. It wont respond to the remote control. The batteries of the remote have been replaced with new one???? Are they worth it ? Not if they only last for 6 months. I have now cancelled my subscription to Prime also. Amazon claim for "next day delivery" is Bull S***. I have bought a lot of items from Amazon....... In my area Amazon use DPD, who offer a 2 day delivery service.....
customer_reviews.author: Woody Dog

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is a neat gizmo. Easy to install and brilliant, especially with Prime membership. I am not big on TV as so much of it is simply boring, but now I have a whole new world of entertainment to trawl for goodies.to watch. Films documentaries, cartoons. Stop, pause, resume. Instant access to any movie whether free, rented or bought. It is actually as good as Amazon say it is. The only downside is that am more interested in books than music, but Prime does not have a la carte menu of features. To be 100% I woukd like the stick with Prime that offers free kindle books and scrub the musicand photos.
customer_reviews.author: Ann
